body:
As a lifelong resident of NYC, my connection to North American servers is quite good. I have about 20-30ms on Avicus and 30-40ms on other US servers. However, since Avicus added the /ping command, I've been constantly bullied by MY OWN team and various salty randies for having such godly ping :(

In order to test out just how much my ping affected my pvp, I started playing EU and AU servers regularly (where I get 150ms and 200ms respectively). While I noticed a very slight delay in my hit registration, I found no difference in my skill level. In other words, I still found myself beating players I could normally beat using the same amount of effort. This led me to question the actual effect of ping on pvp and how much one can truly blame on connection. 

What are your thoughts on this matter?

In order to test out just how much my ping affected my pvp, I started playing EU and AU servers regularly (where I get 150ms and 200ms respectively). While I noticed a very slight delay in my hit registration, I found no difference in my skill level. In other words, I still found myself beating players I could normally beat using the same amount of effort. This led me to question the actual effect of ping on pvp and how much one can truly blame on connection. 

What are your thoughts on this matter?

replies.body:
If you want to raise your ping for testing what ping is best, this tool works great: https://jagt.github.io/clumsy/index.html
Set filtering to "ip.DstAddr ==158.69.120.209 or ip.SrcAddr == 158.69.120.209" (without the quotes), select "lag", by how much you want to delay, and hit start.
The above filter will raise your ping to the avicus server but not to anything else (google, etc)
replies.body_tagged:
If you want to raise your ping for testing what ping is best, this tool works great: https://jagt.github.io/clumsy/index.html
Set filtering to "ip.DstAddr ==158.69.120.209 or ip.SrcAddr == 158.69.120.209" (without the quotes), select "lag", by how much you want to delay, and hit start.
The above filter will raise your ping to the avicus server but not to anything else (google, etc)

replies.body:
Tbh I don't think it's a big difference between having 30-50 ping on EU servers (us servers for you) and 100-130 on us servers. I mean it's just like some milliseconds. Also, maybe if you're used to 30-40 ping it could look/feel like the hits are delayed a bit cus ur not used to 100+ ping.

I wouldn't say it matters to me but on AU servers I get like 300-350 ping.

EU: 30-50 ping
US: 100-150 ping
AU: 150-350 ping

replies.body:
There is a slight difference between 30 and 100 ping, it is even more noticeable with 30 and 150+.

Ping doesn't matter too much on Minecraft compared to say a FPS (first-person shooter) game.

Low ping is always best, but as {tag=58d037b7dccc4f2eadd4011c6f484555} said having a 100ish ping isn't great as you don't get neither the better hit registration of low ping nor the delayed kb/hits of 150+ ping.
replies.body_tagged:
There is a slight difference between 30 and 100 ping, it is even more noticeable with 30 and 150+.

Ping doesn't matter too much on Minecraft compared to say a FPS (first-person shooter) game.

Low ping is always best, but as  Lokigh said having a 100ish ping isn't great as you don't get neither the better hit registration of low ping nor the delayed kb/hits of 150+ ping.

replies.body: I think ping doesn't really matter, it's the level on skill the player has. For example I used to get bad ping (now it's decent but not great), and I my skill level was the same. Honestly I don't think ping matters.

replies.body: Ping is definitely not the most important factor in a person's ability to PvP, though in situations between those of equal skill, it can give an advantage to one side; However in most cases players like Rinn would likely still best you or be bested by you irrelevant of ping, but it can give the opportunity for lucky wins or good combo hits.

replies.body:
Ping doesn't matter too much as long as your connection is consistent 
Inconsistencies in ping and packet loss are where the real problems occur 
A connection makes things different this difference can both be interpreted as an advantage and disadvantage depending on the person, context and such 
If you want to see an example of this watch the video on my channel called pinger in that video I was on a really bad connection then watch me play without it 
It makes things so different
